slides.subTitle: Start by lying or sitting down. Relax your entire body. Take five deep, slow breaths.
Lift your toes upward. Hold, then let go.
Pull your toes downward. Hold, then let go.
Move your knees toward each other. Hold, then let go.
Clench your hands. Pause, then let go.
Tense your arms. Hold, then let go.
Contract your abdominal muscles. Pause, then let go.
Inhale and tighten your chest. Hold, then exhale and let go.
Raise your shoulders to your ears. Pause, then let go.
Close your eyes tightly. Pause, then release.

slides.title: 1. Find a Quiet Space:
slides.subTitle: Choose a quiet and comfortable space where you can sit or lie down. Make sure you won't be disturbed during the exercise.

slides.title: 2. Close Your Eyes:
slides.subTitle: Gently close your eyes to block out external distractions.

slides.title: 3. Deep Breathing:
slides.subTitle: Take a few deep breaths to calm your body and mind. Inhale slowly through your nose, hold for a moment, and exhale slowly through your mouth. Repeat this a few times to relax.

slides.title: 4. Choose a Peaceful Image:
slides.subTitle: Imagine a peaceful and serene place. It could be a quiet forest, a tranquil beach, a meadow, or any location where you feel relaxed and content.

slides.title: 5. Focus on Details:
slides.subTitle: Begin to visualize the details of this place. Imagine the colors, shapes, and features. Picture the scenery as vividly as you can.

slides.title: 6. Engage Your Senses:
slides.subTitle: Bring your senses into the visualization. Imagine the sounds, such as birds singing or waves crashing. Feel the warmth of the sun or a gentle breeze on your skin. Imagine the scent of nature or the ocean air.

slides.title: 7. Embrace Calm Emotions:
slides.subTitle: As you immerse yourself in this peaceful place, focus on the emotions it evokes. Feel the calm, serenity, and relaxation that come from being in this beautiful location

slides.title: 8. Stay Present:
slides.subTitle: Keep your mind focused on this tranquil scene. If your thoughts start to wander, gently guide your attention back to the visualization.

slides.title: 9. Conclude the Exercise:
slides.subTitle: As your chosen time limit approaches, start to transition out of the visualization. Become aware of your physical surroundings and the sensation of your body. Gently wiggle your fingers and toes.

slides.title: 10. Open Your Eyes:
slides.subTitle: When you're ready, open your eyes.

slides.title: Notice 5 things that you can see.
slides.subTitle: How does it look? Do you notice any patterns on it? What's the most prominent color?

slides.title: Notice 4 things that you can touch.
slides.subTitle: How does it feel? What's the texture like? What is it made of?

slides.title: Notice 3 things that you can hear.
slides.subTitle: How loud is it? What is it saying? Where is it coming from?

slides.title: Notice 2 things that you can smell.
slides.subTitle: What are the notes of the scent? Is it strong, or is it subtle?

slides.title: Notice 1 thing that you can taste
slides.subTitle: What's the flavor profile?
